reviews.text: Partie pier. Good for pleasure at bar. Above 150 USD for the table with nice view alongside the river.
Amazed with their high speed elevator, so smooth you won’t ever feel it’s moving

A beautiful place to visit while staying in Guangzhou. The Canton Tower is a 604 metres tall multi-purpose observation tower in the Haizhu District of the city of Guangzhou (historically known as Canton). The tower briefly held the title of tallest tower in the world, replacing the CN Tower, before being surpassed by the Tokyo Skytree. It was the tallest structure in China prior to the topping out of Shanghai Tower on 3 August 2013. It is now the second tallest tower and the fourth-tallest freestanding structure in the world. Instagram @profnasr
Amazing experience in Gaunzhou.. Would like to visit again soon.

The Canton Tower (Chinese: 广州塔), formally Guangzhou TV Astronomical and Sightseeing Tower (Chinese: 广州电视台天文及观光塔), is a 604 metres (1,982 ft) tall multi-purpose observation tower. It was the tallest structure in China prior to the topping out of Shanghai Tower on 3 August 2013. It is now the second tallest tower and the fourth-tallest freestanding structure in the world.
Partie pier. Good for pleasure at bar. Above 150 USD for the table with nice view alongside the river.
Amazed with their high speed elevator, so smooth you won’t ever feel it’s moving

The Canton Tower is a 604 metres tall multi-purpose observation tower in the Haizhu District of the city of Guangzhou (historically known as Canton). The tower briefly held the title of tallest tower in the world, replacing the CN Tower, before being surpassed by the Tokyo Skytree. The Canton Tower (Chinese: 广州塔), formally Guangzhou TV Astronomical and Sightseeing Tower (Chinese: 广州电视台天文及观光塔), is a 604 metres (1,982 ft) tall multi-purpose observation tower. It was the tallest structure in China prior to the topping out of Shanghai Tower on 3 August 2013. It is now the second tallest tower and the fourth-tallest freestanding structure in the world.

A huge cathedral, probably the biggest in Guangzhou. It is located in between small alleyways that sell very cheap local snacks and fruits. Do take note that like many tourist sites, this cathedral is closed on Monday.

A Unique, Serine, 130 year old Catholic Church.
This Church is an unexpected, but very welcoming place to visit. After 25 years, it was finally completed in 1888 [the last three digits are very important to many Chinese (in China and abroad)]. The twin spires of the building is very unusual in Guangzhou... and is made entirely of granite. It is located in the heart of the old city and near the river. Perhaps most interesting of all is the "refreshing, calm, ambience", the mass is in 
English. It can be readily accessed by the subway. It is also very highly rated (by travellers).

I hope that this Review has been helpful.

Located almost in the middle of many wholesale centers - toys, dried food, stationery, paper products etc.. Stand a magnificent and grand cathedral with many local shops near by. I brought my family and many friends there before and they love it. Highly recommended for first timer in Guangzhou.
Can't image that GuangZhou has such a spectacular cathedral!!

A bigger temple than Temple of the six banyan trees. Very airy and tranquil. Paid 5 or 10 yuan for the entrance fee. A temple where the locals come. This temple seemed popular with the locals but it is also perceived as more ritualistic. There are many eateries outside the temple which serve good local food.
nice temple with big tree
The place  you fell great  Muslim Masjid and Abhi Waqas Tomb
Nice place to be !
Lovely Buddhist temple!
This is a great Temple to visit!
You can take a look because it's near to Dr. Sun Yat-sen's Memorial Hall .

If you are close to the Dr. Sun Yat-sen's Memorial Hall und want to walk to the Museum of Western Art of the Han Dynasty, just leave the park at the north gate.
The temple is interesting, especially it is still in use.
good
鬧中取靜，建築物的建材講究

目前仍在維修中，雖然算是維修完成，但是未驗收，所以2018年八月是不可進入，用料超等， 結構簡練， 造型雄渾，氣勢磅礴。

       大雄寶殿殿內陳列福州建築圖片，其內容包括城垣、祠宇廟堂、民居、塔和橋樑。殿內陳列實物有20世紀80年代對大殿大修時更換下來的材料；還有一座按二十分之一比例縮小的大殿模型，模型中結構、斗栱、榫卯等都按原樣縮小製作。

       長江以南最古老的建築
位於福州鼓樓區北隅、屏山南麓，福建省人民政府東側。北宋乾德二年（964年），吳越國王錢氏割據時，福州郡守為祈求國境安寧而建，初名“越山吉祥禪院”。並將讀書處命名為「絕學寮」。明宣德六年（1431年）華林寺重建，正統九年（1444年），御賜匾額「華林寺」，遂改此名，一直沿用至今。

華林寺歷經幾多春秋，僅存大殿，文革後，後增建山門、左右配殿和廊廡。配殿內有一些篆書殘碑猶存。西配殿陳列大雄寶殿修復過程，存有文獻、圖紙、照片和建築構件實物。迴廊東南角，立清康熙年「華林禪寺香燈碑」；而其西南角，立宋高宗趙構御書碑刻殘額一方。

    華林寺大殿梁架與斗拱等構架為最初的原物。建築古樸雄渾，工藝精湛。大殿用材為一等材，規格超等，構件碩大且外形精美。宋《營造法式》規定，九至十一間大殿方可用一等材；而華林寺大殿僅面闊三間，進深四間，卻用一等材，是中國古建築的一個特例

主體結構

華林寺大殿的梭形殿柱
華林寺大殿平面近方形[16]:85[38]。20世紀80年代修復後，大殿坐北朝南，其平面由前廊和殿身二部分構成，進深四間中，前一間乃前廊，後三間乃殿身[47]。面闊三間15.87米，中間6.51米，旁間各4.68米；進深四間14.68米，前後兩間各深3.84米，中間兩間各深3.5米[47][6]。大殿構架抬梁式，單檐九脊頂[6]，全部瓦頂乃筒板布瓦[16]:85。殿高15.5米，大殿面積574平方米[6]。台明面積495.6平方米[16]:85。

其18根殿柱皆為梭形柱[46]，其中內柱4根，檐柱18根。殿內構架主要為兩縫橫架和兩縫縱架所組成，呈「井」字形縱橫相交；兩橫架外，各加出際梁架一縫，承兩山出際[注 8][47]。大殿內柱子採用減柱法[16]:85，四根內柱高7.2米[47]。檐柱肥而短[16]:86。 前後檐平柱[注 9]與兩山次角柱[注 10]、中柱[注 11]皆高1.78米，四根角柱高4.86米。內柱、角柱、前檐平柱及兩山前次角柱之底徑0.64米，後檐平柱、兩山後次角柱、兩山中柱之底徑0.6米。[47]內柱、檐柱及柱頭由間額、額枋縱橫聯結，形成外層大方形框架結構[16]:85。各柱最大直徑在下部三分之一處，向兩端逐漸卷殺，至柱頂緊殺如覆盆狀；這種兩頭卷殺的做法，曾在南北朝盛行，隋唐後在華極為少見。[47]內柱高過檐柱2.6米，這原是為了容下內槽佛像[16]:85。四根內柱前後中距7米，內柱頭雖有升起，惟與縫上之中平槫有2~3米高差距，在這段距離里，斗栱與枋層層疊置，使斗栱與梁架交融，柱以上幾乎全用斗栱支撐[47]，梁的作用反而比斗栱小[16]:88。

大殿鋪作
大殿四檐及內柱頭均施斗栱，而柱頭上更用特別粗大的斗栱承托[16]:85。與四周檐柱上三層首尾相接，形成不在同一標高上的鋪作層。斗栱用材碩大，單材31.5×16厘米，斷面2:1，這個比例在同時代實物中罕見。斗栱總高為檐高三分之四。[16]:88而關於斗栱的配置，只在前檐用了補心鋪作，當心間兩朵，而兩次間各一朵[16]:88。 大殿採用單栱素方面重疊的「扶壁栱」原始構造形式。在外檐柱頭櫨斗上第一層為泥道栱，栱上為素方，方上為令栱，栱上又為素方[16]:91。 斗栱簡潔嚴謹，外檐鋪作外轉均為七鋪作雙抄[注 12]雙昂出四挑，第一與第三挑偷心[注 13]，第二挑頭施重栱承羅漢方，而第四挑頭施令栱承撩檐方，與令栱相交的耍頭位置出昂，所以外觀上是雙抄三下昂[47][12]。 耍頭做法與下昂一致[16]:88。 昂嘴的曲線分三段，上乃一梟，下乃一混，而中乃一梟混。沿著曲線輪廓微刻一道線腳[53]。 內向斗栱鋪作均按需要，隨宜加減，大量運用插栱[46]。 栱鬥鬥耳[注 14]較高且有曲線，下端外張；斗底為單混線腳，厚1.5厘米，向內收2厘米，線腳下又有一個直線腳，約0.5厘米厚[53]。斗底有皿板[注 15]痕跡，保存魏晉風格[46]。山面斗栱後尾連續用五跳偷心華栱及下昂[16]:88。 栱頭卷殺五瓣，上為高約14厘米直線，微微向內收約0.5厘米；下有連續曲線，而曲率較小[53]，不用於華北唐遼建築，與《營造法式》記載也有不同之處。至於單材華栱，山中柱鋪所用昂長兩架椽，昂尾伸到中平分位，昂身碩大，與山面梁架的結構作用同，日本法隆寺及唐招提寺金堂建築中的昂與其結構作用有相似處。[16]:91

大殿前檐作補間鋪作

側面檐下鋪作

斗拱作七鋪作雙抄雙下昂重拱偷心造，斗底作皿板形

轉角鋪作

山面中柱里跳華栱及下昂

裝飾構件

左圖華林寺大殿前檐闌額月梁造
右圖大殿內丁字栱、月梁、駝峰
闌額、乳栿[注 16]均屬月梁造作法，造型古樸[46]。月梁包括四櫞栿、平梁與前後檐乳栿。兩山後次角柱上乳栿、前檐當心間以及次間闌額共計七種十三根，都是用粗大原木製成，斷面近圓形，直徑皆約0.54米，造型渾圓豐盈，兩端由梁背及兩側三方面卷殺至八榫殺，仰視乃梭形。[53]額上不施普拍枋，前檐補間鋪作直接坐於闌額上。 大殿有三種駝峰，他們不僅尺度巨大，且有流暢自由的輪廓曲線。後縱架兩柱柱頭內額上承補間令栱的雲形駝峰，曲線對稱，2.92米長，0.5米背上，兩端各置有一個小駝峰，承平梁下斗栱，1.8米長，0.45米高，而曲線不對稱，優美簡潔。後檐與兩山後次角乳栿上，各自有一個巨大的雲形駝峰，曲線不對稱，2.84米長，厚0.1米，1米高，恍若逸雲，動勢強烈。[53]大殿多用駝峰而少用蜀柱，各槫外端頂部用生頭木[16]:88。福州文史專家楊秉綸[57]的《福州華林寺大殿》提到，該大殿內構件造型優美，使大殿在古樸雄渾中顯出南方建築特有的輕快秀麗格調[16]:87。

脊檁、前廊東西和後檐乳栿的下皮，保留有清朝康熙三十六年（1697年）、道光四年（1824年）、同治十三年（1874年）等重修的紀年題刻，此外還有「法輪常轉」「國界[注 17]安寧」「皇圖鞏固」「帝道遐昌」「佛日增輝」等宋代以來吉祥語題刻[16]:86。。

   主要大殿是五代末，宋初原物。大殿為抬樑式構架，單簷九脊頂，高15.5米,面積574平方米。大殿有18根木柱，柱子以上全由斗拱支撐，不用一根鐵釘。其建造手法在全國唐宋木構建築中獨具一格，對日本鎌倉時期（12世紀末）的“大佛樣”、“天絲樣”建築風格影響頗大。儘管福州地區多雨潮濕，白蟻繁生，木構建築很難以存，但華林寺的主要構件卻仍然保存九百多年前的原物，是我國長江以南最古老的木建築寺院，為研究我國古代建築的珍貴實物資料。 1983年被列為全國第二批重點文物保護單位。
      
門票價格：2元人民幣

位于福州鼓楼区北隅、屏山南麓，福建省人民政府东侧。北宋乾德二年（964年），吴越国王钱氏割据时，福州郡守为祈求国境安宁而建，初名“越山吉祥禅院”。
华林寺历经几多春秋，仅存大殿，后增建山门、左右配殿和廊庑。大殿为抬梁式构架，单檐九脊顶，高15.5米,面积574平方米。大殿有18根木柱，柱子以上全由斗拱支撑，不用一根铁钉。其建造手法在全国唐宋木构建筑中独具一格，对日本镰仓时期（12世纪末）的“大佛样”、“天丝样”建筑风格影响颇大。 尽管福州地区多雨潮湿，白蚁繁生，木构建筑很难以存，但华林寺的主要构件却仍然保存九百多年前的原物，是我国长江以南最古老的木建筑寺院，为研究我国古代建筑的珍贵实物资料。1983年被列为全国第二批重点文物保护单位。
门票价格：5元人民币
千年木建築， 好美
南方现存最古老的寺了，格局估计以前不是这样的，到福州，一定得去看看，门票只要2块

Great museum, clean and easy to navigate. Bring your passport or similar ID as a tourist and they will give you a free ticket. Most exhibitions had English descriptions on the items however some are Chinese only

There are many available exhibitions and rooms ranging from history, trade, animals, and even a special room when I was there  featuring fans. 

Free admission for foreigners if you show an ID, there is possibility to leave bags in free lockers as well.

I was hoping to maximize my morning there and so I purchased a 30rmb audio guide.. However, the flow within the history rooms especially were Not intuitive.. jumping from one century to another. The one narrating could not have been more bland and boring too, so I was feeling quite sleepy just a few minutes in!

The other rooms like the one dedicated to fans was more interesting but was not covered by the audio guide. For kids, it will be most enjoyable to go to the animal history section with perhaps full size assembly of dino bone (replicas I suppose) and an assortment of other sea creatures too.

Since tickets are free, it's a nice spot to visit but maybe pass on the audio guide.
I had a spare day in Guangzhou and was lucky enough to find this museum.  Take your passport and they let tourists in for free.  The building is enormous but the galleries are well laid out.

An enjoyable museum with many interesting galleries and a diverse collection: cheongsams, potteries, landscape paintings, some calligraphy, inkstones. It's a vast building and spread over 3-4 floors. Entrance is free but your will need to provide your passport.
I really liked the department with dinosaurs and stones.

Great museum, clean and easy to navigate. Bring your passport or similar ID as a tourist and they will give you a free ticket. Most exhibitions had English descriptions on the items however some are Chinese only

There are many available exhibitions and rooms ranging from history, trade, animals, and even a special room when I was there  featuring fans. 

Free admission for foreigners if you show an ID, there is possibility to leave bags in free lockers as well.

I was hoping to maximize my morning there and so I purchased a 30rmb audio guide.. However, the flow within the history rooms especially were Not intuitive.. jumping from one century to another. The one narrating could not have been more bland and boring too, so I was feeling quite sleepy just a few minutes in!

The other rooms like the one dedicated to fans was more interesting but was not covered by the audio guide. For kids, it will be most enjoyable to go to the animal history section with perhaps full size assembly of dino bone (replicas I suppose) and an assortment of other sea creatures too.

Since tickets are free, it's a nice spot to visit but maybe pass on the audio guide.
I had a spare day in Guangzhou and was lucky enough to find this museum.  Take your passport and they let tourists in for free.  The building is enormous but the galleries are well laid out.

An enjoyable museum with many interesting galleries and a diverse collection: cheongsams, potteries, landscape paintings, some calligraphy, inkstones. It's a vast building and spread over 3-4 floors. Entrance is free but your will need to provide your passport.
I really liked the department with dinosaurs and stones.

I visited in Guangzhou for checking products in the Canton Fair. And I came here ;Guangdong Museum  of  Art ;to take experience about Chinese art. There were three exhibitions. It was so satisfying and gratefully free opening offers to visitors. It gave me good energy. The bathroom was  normal Chinese's style,  but there was nothing dirty about the smell as many other toilet. You cannot bring in any kind of water. Around the museum, there are wonderful parks. I recommend here for you want to take a very valuable rest.
Free entrance, lots of exhibitions and very nice building

The Museum is on an idealic Island. The parks and gardens are beautiful and this Museum was a nice place to visit. The artwork was interesting and there was a nice variety. Admission was free and closing time is 5pm.
It's quiet. The artworks are beautiful.
Closed on Mondays
Very nice moment
紀念館隔離係國安局派出所，一定十分安全
Cok guzel biyer tatil yapmak isteynlere güzel bir tavsiyem
环境不错很棒
It showed a brief glimpse of how the revolution started in Guangzhou.
羅仲霍伯公72烈士之一

An interesting area to witness Guangzhou's creativity.
This centrally located area was formerly a series of "old style" factories. When better factories became available, it was abandoned for a few years. In 2009, it was decided to make it available to groups/people with "an "artistic/creative bent"... As such, it is a very interesting "Arts Zone", with an ambience of "wanna-be, trendy and vintage style"-- and is full of neat, enjoyable surprises! It seems that with the passing of time, it expands and new ventures appear due to the initiative and creativity of people/groups drawn to it!! In addition to small workshops/shoppes there are also some wonderful restaurants. In addition to the many opportunities for taking photos, its a great way to get a different feel about Guangzhou...

I hope that this Review has been helpful!

Definitely a spot worth going to. Lots of nice art-sy shops and galleries, and it's always expanding. I've been here a year before and I can definitely say there is more each time I come back. There are western food restaurants, Chinese food, and places to just have a drink. The galleries I think change every few months so there is always more, and just a very good place to take pictures and walk about.
Nice place to chill and take pictures.

Redtory is a great place to spend an afternoon exploring. It feels similar to Granville Island in Vancouver Canada as it is an old industrial space that has been uniquely transformed into a gathering place for the art community. There are lots of interesting old structures to look around, great artist exhibits, small shops, and places to dine. I really enjoyed my time here.

A great place to spend hours here. Very very comfortable place in guangzhou. It is even better if you go there during cold weather, slow walk with relaxing mood makes us feel satisfy visiting here. Buildings are all well maintain and great place for photoshoot

It cost 25 Yuan per adult per entry. Cheaper rates for old people with card, children etc. A peaceful and beautiful place to visit. Many types of flowers, flowering trees, sculptures, water fountains are present. Suitable for all ages and for someone in wheelchair as well, although accessibility for some areas could be limited due to stairs. Visitor can spend 2-3 hours in their first visit but once a favourite spot is found they can just sit and enjoy the scenery for hours.

13AUG2016 . I traveled there . Its beautiful place . you will like this place .  Yuntai Garden is the largest park of its type in China and is often known as the Pearl of Flower City of Guangzhou. The garden is spread over an area of around 120,000 square meters. It is located at the northern entry of the Baiyun Mountain and is known for its beautiful scenery.
 
Yuntai Garden’s layout and structure are known to be quite unique with its Earth Stone Carving, Roman Column and Colorful River along with the 200 differnet types of rare flowers from all over the world.
A beautiful park that could take an hour or so to walk around. Just at the base of the Baiyun mountain. Entry is 10rmb. It’s enclosed so you won’t be able to go up the mountain from here.
A place full with colorful flowers n peaceful fountains....visit this garden before you ride the cable car to Baiyun Mountain

We went on a weekday and it was super quiet and not crowded at all. The place is well kept and very clean. Great place for a walk to enjoy the scenary. It only cost 5RMB per person to enter, which is less than 1 USD at the time of this post.
Impressive large park. Stunning museum - local equivalent of British museum - has lots of very old art objects from various dynasties.

A Diverse, Large, Super scenic Park.
This park and its extensive "water features" cover about 25 acres/100 hectares. The one kilometre river interconnects with the two lakes and one bay. There are about 30 bridges built over these waterways! There are also many examples of Chinese pottery, porcelain and brick sculptures as well as a Bronze statue of Confucius. The gardens include an area devoted to Roses and another devoted to Orchids. There are also four halls which exemplify historic architecture and paintings. While the weekends are quite busy, the weekdays are much less so! It is accessible as one can go by Metro. A visit will enrich your memories of Guangzhou!!

I hope that this Review has been helpful.
Gorgeous gardens & water park, with traditional structures, beautiful walks, and statues. There are a couple of museums as well. You can also find restaurants there.
Awesome place with educational value and beautiful scenery.  Can probably spend 2 to 3 hours there.  Lots and lots and lots of fishes there.  Kids just enjoy feeding the fish so much.
great place to go for a walk, original being destroyed. rebuilded in recent time. lots of structure are beautifully built replicas, worth a visit if one has not been there.

This is a nice hotel that is affordable and convenient to the airport. It is far from anything else you might want to do in Guangzhou but I have stayed the night before a flight as it is 15 minutes from the airport by free shuttle,  cab, or metro stop 1 minute walk from the front door. The restaurant is good and the staff is friendly.
Very good service, clean and comfortable guest room.
Best hotel in Huadu. Clean hotel nice breakfast
Nice international hotel, clean, quiet good breakfast with a direct shuttle to the airport

Good hotel but far away from downtown
It seems to be in no mans land
Million Sunflower Garden  Guangzhou Xiao Qing Xiao Qing Art Photo Resort! While the sun is shining   While the breeze is quiet, while the flowers are not yet in full blossom, have a leisurely stroll!
nice place to visit in guangzhou. lotsa beautiful flowers
Big and more flower
Good
VG

Make sure you buy your tickets online, even if you do it right outside the gate, you'll save a few bucks.

Went during the week and found the park was fairly empty. The adrenaline type rides can't be faulted although everything else is a little boring. 

The spooky tunnel thing, for example was fairly silly to walk through as was the 3D ride, which takes you into the future.

Otherwise, easily accessible by subway and worth a visit if you just want to do the big things over a couple hours. If I had to go back, I'd pack a lunch because the food is both expensive and limited in choice.

The park is well organized... very clean water and atmosphere

Designed by two internationally renowned Canadian theme park design companies - Whitewater and Forrec, Chimelong Water Park in Guangzhou is a world famous water park. The park covers an area of 450 mu. The park uses the most advanced ozone water filtration system to provide tourists with a clean, safe and exciting water experience. Most importantly, as the largest and most advanced water park in the world, all water rides in the park are imported, and most of them are award-winning.
Fun games! Long queue though
Astonishing place...And even better than ocean park in Hong Kong
Good place to enjoy for children. But need more space and improvement. But only waterpark around this area.
A little crowded but plausible due to the breathtaking view at the peak! Definitely worth the walk!
so so. Nothing special
Use this gate for cable way or cable car
This is a good place for Hiking and enjoy the nature.
nice place

Went there for dim sum at 9.30am in the morning. This is a 3 storey building with traditional Chinese setting. Totally love it. If you can’t read Chinese might be a bit challenging to order the food. Overall the food is delicious, the tea is the traditional way of drinking. Been eating dim sum in different parts of the world but this is consider one of the better one. Would go back to eat.

The best dimsum I've tried so far! Food were awesome. I can feel the ingredients were fresh. Generous portions too. The restaurant setting was traditional Cantonese style. That made the taste of food even more authentic. Do expect the restaurant to be noisy as it's part of the local culture, I guess.  

A must-try! Satisfaction guaranteed

Our first restaurant at Guangzhou. I was looking forward to great dim sum at Guangzhou. Maybe we didn’t order the correct items. 

It is mandatory to order tea at dim sum restaurants in Guangzhou. They gave us a selection to choose from. We choose ¥8 per pax. However, the bill came with a charge of ¥15 per pax. We informed them and the bill was revised accordingly.

Delicious and historic dim sum place, but I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you can either speak Chinese or you can bring someone who does.  The language barrier is tough here.  No English menus, and the place is set up with individual rooms for tables, so you can't point at passing carts like you could in other dim sum places.  Still good though.  Using hand gestures, they'll ask for a drink order, and if you say anything other than tea, the whole room will laugh at you.  It's fun though

There are no dim sum carts. You order what you want and they deliver it to your table as soon as it is ready. I thought the food was bland and a bit expensive. Not a must check out spot for dim sum.

The door of the restaurant is open so if it is cold and windy outside, you will feel it inside too.

Tables are shared. Bring your own napkins. Credit cards are accepted.

The restaurant looked amazing. As soon as you step onto the premises, all the way to your table, the view is quite something. They even have greeters dressed the part at the entrance waiting to seat you at a table.

The food was well presented but was bland which seems to be a standard for the city/province/country. I'm used to food with salt and spices.

reviews.author_name: Guangzhou Private Tour Guide Sourcing Agent China
reviews.text: A time-honored brand restaurant with large gardens in Guangzhou. It was interesting to have breakfast there when many locals reading newspaper or just chatting. Among Guangzhou locals, this restaurant symbolizes the part of lifestyle of Guangzhou. The delicacies such as Dim Sum are so nice. For travelers, this location is excellent, as there is the famous Lizhiwan Scenic Spot of ancient buildings and lanes.

This restaurant has open more than hundred years wow...very authentic Chinese restaurant including the architecture with garden. For me the food is just okay but worth to give a try. Maybe next time come back for the dimsum.

This is a unique place for dimsum. The restaurant is refurbished from the old chinese houses with large garden and small water features and a lake. Food here is alright, slightly pricey, but if this place serve as tourist spot and restaurant then it definitely worth a visit. Local frequent here daily but the place is so big that you wont feel crowded. Better to come with some local if possible, as this is not a touristy spot and communication might be a slight barrier. Lucky for us the menu is all pictures. Walking around the lake is free if you are not into the dimsum. I learnt that the surrounding area is of historical value, can easily spend half a day around the area and walk through the old town, perfectly safe.

Waiter/Waitress kept on missing out our orders.  After a few reminders,  all orders has been keyed in properly but food took ages to arrive. Waited 30 minutes+- for the steam buns (char siew pao) & decided to cancel it as most of us had finished our food but the waiter/ Waitresses & manager doesn't allowed us to cancelled n insist that we have to wait for it to be serve! So rude!

Went there for dim sum at 9.30am in the morning. This is a 3 storey building with traditional Chinese setting. Totally love it. If you can’t read Chinese might be a bit challenging to order the food. Overall the food is delicious, the tea is the traditional way of drinking. Been eating dim sum in different parts of the world but this is consider one of the better one. Would go back to eat.

The best dimsum I've tried so far! Food were awesome. I can feel the ingredients were fresh. Generous portions too. The restaurant setting was traditional Cantonese style. That made the taste of food even more authentic. Do expect the restaurant to be noisy as it's part of the local culture, I guess.  

A must-try! Satisfaction guaranteed

Our first restaurant at Guangzhou. I was looking forward to great dim sum at Guangzhou. Maybe we didn’t order the correct items. 

It is mandatory to order tea at dim sum restaurants in Guangzhou. They gave us a selection to choose from. We choose ¥8 per pax. However, the bill came with a charge of ¥15 per pax. We informed them and the bill was revised accordingly.

Delicious and historic dim sum place, but I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you can either speak Chinese or you can bring someone who does.  The language barrier is tough here.  No English menus, and the place is set up with individual rooms for tables, so you can't point at passing carts like you could in other dim sum places.  Still good though.  Using hand gestures, they'll ask for a drink order, and if you say anything other than tea, the whole room will laugh at you.  It's fun though

There are no dim sum carts. You order what you want and they deliver it to your table as soon as it is ready. I thought the food was bland and a bit expensive. Not a must check out spot for dim sum.

The door of the restaurant is open so if it is cold and windy outside, you will feel it inside too.

Tables are shared. Bring your own napkins. Credit cards are accepted.
Close for renovation. Start from sept 11th 2018. Reno period 6-12mth
Nice and comfortable seating but average dim sum. And pricy too. Not value for money.
decent dim sum but 广州酒家 is way better.
Closed for renovation until 2019 Dec
We usually have tea and dimsum here as they have a good variety of choices. Classic traditional food here! Yum

The people are nice. It's not like charge for water or for condiments or for eating at the restaurant (service charge). What you see is what you pay.

Food was alright though. It is decent but for the prices you pay it is worth it.

Aaah this is such a great place to eat good Indian food. To all Indians who are traveling to Hong Kong and want to eat good authentic Indian style food please visit this place. I guarantee that you won't be disappointed. Taste is really good better than most of the Indian restaurants in India. The Sharma Uncle and Aunty are really sweet aswell.

Must go restaurant if you're in Hong kong.
Taste like you are eating at home.
Large menu...quick service.
Best thing its totally vegetarian.
Will come again when ever we visit Hong kong.
good taste with reasonable price

I had dinner at Sharmaji last night and trust me guys it was a proper Indian meal. After spending 2 days at Hongkong, my husband and I were literally hunting for a decent eatery with decent enough menu. Most places in Hongkong serve boiled vegetables under rarely included vegetarian dishes. Sharmaji turned out to be a blessing for us. The food was served fresh and hot. The owner Ms Jamunaji showered her hospitality on us. The pricing was reasonable. We had samosas, dal fry, paneer butter masala, tawa rotis, two rounds of Indian masala tea.. all for under 300HKD,  total value for money if compared to other food joints serving boiled vegetables and charging an exorbitant amount. We had a great time at Sharmaji. 😊😊
Not a bad place to eat. Mainly you just a courage to get in start. Pork ribs, meat, poultry, real Chinese.
It takes too long, I waited about 100minutes and asked to check my order is going.i should refuse to wait and cancel my lunch. Definitely wasting of time.
Good food, could be warmer. Eggs and shrimp are nice. Milk papaya soup (Hashima) in a frog is best!
medium food

Chinesisches Essen und nettes Ambiente. Für Europäer etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig und Bestellung muss mit Händen und Füßen erfolgen, da die Bedienung kein Englisch verstehen. Etwas lange Wartezeit auf das Essen. Vielleicht müssen wir ein zweites mal dorthin :)
菜单品种不算多，这家特色是炸猪排！
My favorite Italian restaurant!  Great with kids and they take Visa and Mastercard.

Just came out of OGGI Pizzeria Canton Place Guangzhou , one of our order was below quality which was fully charged and no apology , rather the manager was rude to say everyone likes it .. 
Bad Experience with Rude attitude !

for the longest time we guangzhou expats knew oggi as the gold standard of pizza, but in the last year, the crust-dough has changed for the worst and, when we discovered a roach in our siciliana, we have been less-frequent denizens.
Wrong directions
Good pizza in China not bad at all
My favorite Italian restaurant!  Great with kids and they take Visa and Mastercard.

Just came out of OGGI Pizzeria Canton Place Guangzhou , one of our order was below quality which was fully charged and no apology , rather the manager was rude to say everyone likes it ..

Wrong directions
Good pizza in China not bad at all

Was happy to find known recipes and tastes in Guangzhou. Any thing else was just unexpected tastes. This restaurant came out like a super solution to solve the unusual foods' taste in China. We had mouton's neck, lentils soup, pie. And kounafa for sweet with tea and mint. 

The food is really tasty.
It's simply the best Turkish restaurant in the city , location , service , prices , dishes ,all
Poor quality. Not related to Turkish kitchen at all.   Avoid it if you can
Awesome food, decent service. Slightly overpriced.
Extremely delicious food, very warm staff and owner himself was a gentleman, overall enjoyed the dinner & Turkish ambience...10/10.
جيد
家族商人
很好逛

This was my favorite restaurant in guangzhou.  Could go there for great grilled did and beer was part of the buffet.

It doesn't get any better!

Now the restaurant is back to typical Chinese- horrible service where you actively have to flag someone down who will still ignore you.  Asking for desired items in menu to only learn they are not available as well as learning my beloved buffet is gone, only to be replaced by inferior small portions of someone's semblance of Western food.

There are some challenges the Italian restaurant now faces... Such as putting true Italian food in the menu among others.

I wish then the best of luck.

Seems that owners have changed. In the past was good and comfortable, little expensive for China prices but OK. Now, the service was really slow and not Italian at all; they decreased the offer of menu; and something’s out of stock. Fortunately we left in advance, seeing other tables.

“A WELL SPREAD BUFFET”

Located just on Huanshi East Road, City Centre Guangzhou opposite Crown Plaza and situated on the 3rd floor, this restaurant has Ala Carte but is well known for its buffet which comes with a good big glass of Chilled Beer.

Ideal for meat lovers, it has a very good spread from Salads to Appetizers to Main Course followed by fruits, desserts and cakes.

To really enjoy the buffet you should reach early by around 8.00pm as the restaurant closes at 11.00pm. Say after 10.30pm itself you would find almost 25% of dishes either finished or not tasting good because of over heating.

Has the facility to sit in open or inside.

Dislike - Too much to eat and at times the staff is non-cooperative.

But overall a very good experience.
Good and varied buffet. The spaghetti is a must eat.
The worst

Was happy to find known recipes and tastes in Guangzhou. Any thing else was just unexpected tastes. This restaurant came out like a super solution to solve the unusual foods' taste in China. We had mouton's neck, lentils soup, pie. And kounafa for sweet with tea and mint. 

The food is really tasty.
It's simply the best Turkish restaurant in the city , location , service , prices , dishes ,all
Poor quality. Not related to Turkish kitchen at all.   Avoid it if you can
Awesome food, decent service. Slightly overpriced.
Extremely delicious food, very warm staff and owner himself was a gentleman, overall enjoyed the dinner & Turkish ambience...10/10.
菜单品种不算多，这家特色是炸猪排！

Love walking into a Starbucks and smelling the fresh coffee. This location was clean and the staff friendly. Coffee was made to order and correctly made for this picky coffee drinker lol. This spot has an area for when you are wanting to socialize or break out the computer/books and do some studying while sipping on a latte. Only problem I seen was the drive through and parking area are very tight but couldn't take a star away just for that. Keep it up at this location cause my little girl and I will definitely be back for our coffee.
Always fast, friendly, and informative! Their coffee is great and their snacks are always yummy! Mobile pickup through their app is always very convenient as well!

Yummy but prices need to stop going up, they  are beyond being a very successful business that has millions of people addicted and stopping for ine of their many yummy beverages and foods almost every day like its crack, stop being greedy with the cost increase of everything, PLEASE. I want to be able to afford my coffee "crack" lol just playing, kinda. Attention there's no illegal drugs served at any Starbucks facility
... that I'm aware of!
Very friendly service. Got the order correct. Fast.
Rude, impersonal staff, slow service, dirty restrooms. The food is blah, you get better quality food at much lower prices at McDonalds or any of the other fast food chains in the area.
